summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney (sender redacted) to Alex Acosta forwarding press coverage documents related to the Jeffrey Epstein case. It references the public release of arrest affidavits and the closure of the police investigation by the State Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Acosta, Alex
persons.context: Recipient of the email containing Epstein press coverage documents; referenced as a key legal official in the case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the press coverage and police investigation; his arrest affidavits were made public.

connections.description: Acosta, as U.S. Attorney, was receiving updates on press coverage and developments in the Epstein case.

events.title: Publication of Epstein Arrest Affidavits
events.description: The Smoking Gun published redacted probable cause affidavits for the arrest of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Publication of Incident Report Portion
events.description: The Smoking Gun published a portion of the incident report related to the Epstein case.

events.title: Email Forwarding Press Coverage
events.description: An Assistant U.S. Attorney emailed Alex Acosta with compiled Epstein press coverage documents.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: The State Attorney's Office shut down the Epstein case, leading the police chief to deem the investigation 'closed'.
Probable cause affidavits for Epstein's arrest became public and were published by The Smoking Gun.
A portion of the incident report was also published by The Smoking Gun.
The email sender references a letter from the Chief that did not mention specifics but acknowledged the case closure.
Multiple press coverage documents were compiled and forwarded to Alex Acosta regarding the Epstein case.
